feed.title: Hermosawave Photography
feed.subtitle: A series of daily landscape photographs by Daniel Sofer, 20 years running.

entry.title: Far & Nearãƒ»è¿‘ãã€é ã
entry.content:
Looking west from Tokyo Skytree tower. Crossing the Sumida River in the foreground are the Kuramae, Umaya, and Komagata bridges. In the center are Yoyogi Park and the Shinjuku Docomo tower, and in the distance is a guest appearance by Mt. Fuji.

entry.title: Evening in Ginzaãƒ»éŠ€åº§ã®å¤œ
entry.content:
I started with the idea of documenting the changes to Ginza since the photo of Nakano Masataka in his book Tokyo Nobody, taken in 1995. His photo was displayed next to mine at the just ended Kyoto Journal exhibition at Kyotographie 2025. According to a look at my maps application, almost none of the buildings from 1995 remain 30 years later, with the exception of the Ginza Lion restaurant at left.

This photo was taken in the evening, where you can see lots of activity. I went back the next morning at 4am (below) and was surprised at the number of taxicabs and occasional trash truck speeding their way down Ginza Chuo Dori at that time. There were even a few people walking around. Whether they were up late or up early was difficult to ascertain. A few of both, I think.

1995å¹´ã«æ’®å½±ã•ã‚ŒãŸä¸­é‡æ­£è²´ã®å†™çœŸé›†ã€Tokyo Nobodyã€ä»¥æ¥ã®éŠ€åº§ã®å¤‰åŒ–ã‚’è¨˜éŒ²ã—ã‚ˆã†ã¨ã„ã†ã‚¢ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚¢ã‹ã‚‰å§‹ã¾ã£ãŸã€‚å½¼ã®å†™çœŸã¯ã€ã¡ã‚‡ã†ã©çµ‚äº†ã—ãŸ Kyotographie 2025ã®äº¬éƒ½ã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ¼ãƒŠãƒ«å±•ã§ç§ã®å†™çœŸã®éš£ã«å±•ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ãŸã€‚ç§ã®åœ°å›³ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã¨ã€å·¦ã®éŠ€åº§ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ªãƒ³ã‚’é™¤ã„ã¦ã€1995å¹´å½“æ™‚ã®å»ºç‰©ã¯30å¹´çµŒã£ã¦ã‚‚ã»ã¨ã‚“ã©æ®‹ã£ã¦ã„ãªã„ã€‚

ã“ã®å†™çœŸã¯å¤•æ–¹ã«æ’®ã£ãŸã‚‚ã®ã§ã€å¤šãã®æ´»æ°—ãŒè¦‹ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚ç¿Œæœ4æ™‚ã«ã‚‚ã†ä¸€åº¦è¡Œã£ã¦ã¿ãŸãŒï¼ˆä¸‹ï¼‰ã€ãã®æ™‚é–“ã«éŠ€åº§ä¸­å¤®é€šã‚Šã‚’ç–¾èµ°ã™ã‚‹ã‚¿ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ¼ã‚„æ™‚æŠ˜ã‚´ãƒŸåé›†è»Šã®å¤šã•ã«é©šã„ãŸã€‚æ­©ã„ã¦ã„ã‚‹äººã‚‚æ•°äººã„ãŸã€‚å½¼ã‚‰ãŒå¤œæ›´ã‹ã—ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã‹æ—©èµ·ãã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã‹ã¯ã‚ã‹ã‚‰ãªã‹ã£ãŸã€‚ãã®ä¸¡æ–¹ã ã¨æ€ã†ã€‚

His photo was displayed next to mine at the just ended Kyoto Journal exhibition at Kyotographie 2025. According to a look at my maps application, almost none of the buildings from 1995 remain 30 years later, with the exception of the Ginza Lion restaurant at left. This photo was taken in the evening, where you can see lots of activity. I went back the next morning at 4am (below) and was surprised at the number of taxicabs and occasional trash truck speeding their way down Ginza Chuo Dori at that time. entry.title: Ice Globeãƒ»æ°·ã®ã‚°ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ–
entry.content:
Kakigori shaved ice is a frozen delicacy popular all over Japan in the summer. There are an astoundingly wide range of takes on this dessert of finely shaven ice, with a soft texture like freshly fallen snow in the best ones. This is a particularly artistic example, with fresh fruit in a glass globe and a cookie on top. It tasted as good as it looks. ğŸ˜€

entry.title: Green Reflected
entry.content:
Verdant green trees reflect in Arashiyama's glassy Oigawa River in this panorama.

entry.title: Afternoon in Greenãƒ»ç·‘ã®åˆå¾Œ
entry.content:
Along the banks of the Katsura River, with Nanohana (Rapeseed flowers) in bloom and the Togetsu Bridge and Mount Arashi in the distance. Everything is the bright green of new leaves.
